New Records: The Cubs have now scored 5+ runs in 12 straight road games - a new franchise record.
Key Match Events: The Chicago Cubs beat the Colorado Rockies 6-2 on Sunday afternoon at Coors Field.
Michael Busch hit two home runs.
Rookie Pete Crow-Armstrong hit his 10th home run.
The Cubs had stolen bases from Nick Hoerner, Seiya Suzuki, and Dansby Swanson.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win moved the Cubs to 76-73 on the season while the loss dropped the Rockies to 57-93.
The Cubs pounded out 11 hits and hit three home runs in the game.
